info.name: FDX Demo
info.description:
This collection implements the FDX Consent Grant Flow as defined in FDX RFC 0156 & allows you to access the Core API endpoints.

Here are the prerequisites to run the requests in this collection:

- API server endpoint is protected with MTLS, so get the certificate & private key from Financial Institution.
    
- Choose the Environment "FDX Demo" from the Environment selector in the top right.
    
- Use the cog button to open Settings
    
    - Choose the Certificates tab. Ensure a certificate is installed for the target environment. If not click "Add Certificate".
        
    - Enter the target host and port and upload the public and private keys (CRT file and KEY file respectively) and click ADD.
        
- Update the current values in the Environment "FDX Demo".
    
- Follow the instructions for each section/request below.

item.name: Get Access Token

request.description: The endpoint retrieves the well-known configuration for the Authorization Server. The response is a JSON object with various properties such as issuer, authorization endpoint, token endpoint, and other supported features and methods related to authentication and authorization.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the JavaScript resource file from the specified URL. This is a one time execution step to create a global variable and this variable is needed in next step.
In this step, we create a signed request object which is then sent in the PAR request in next step.

request.description:
- Once you get the response, go to Visualize tab and copy the available link. You need to use this link in the browser of your choice and complete login.
    
- For login credentials, contact the financial instititution.
    
- Complete the authorization by granting access to accounts.
    
- Once redirects are done, copy the URL from the browser's address bar.

request.description:
### Endpoint Description

This endpoint is used to make an HTTP POST request to obtain a token for authentication. Once you gets the token in response you are ready to call rest of the API endpoints in this collection. No more copy paste required.

### Request Body

- The request body should be of type x-www-form-urlencoded.
    

### Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `access_token` (string): The access token obtained.
    
- `expires_in` (number): The duration until the token expires.
    
- `refresh_expires_in` (number): The duration until the refresh token expires.
    
- `refresh_token` (string): The refresh token obtained.
    
- `token_type` (string): The type of token obtained.
    
- `not-before-policy` (number): Not-before policy value.
    
- `session_state` (string): The session state.
    
- `scope` (string): The scope of the token.
    
- `grant_id` (string): The grant ID.
    

### JSON Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "access_token": { "type": "string" },
    "expires_in": { "type": "number" },
    "refresh_expires_in": { "type": "number" },
    "refresh_token": { "type": "string" },
    "token_type": { "type": "string" },
    "not-before-policy": { "type": "number" },
    "session_state": { "type": "string" },
    "scope": { "type": "string" },
    "grant_id": { "type": "string" }
  }
}

 ```
